function.name: EmitLightningArc
function.summary: Emit a lightning arc.

parameter.name: origin
parameter.description: Lightning origin (start) position.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: Lightning target (end) position.

parameter.name: color
parameter.description: Color.

parameter.name: life
parameter.description: Lifetime in seconds. Clamped to [0, 4.233] for now because of strange internal maths.

parameter.name: amplitude
parameter.description: Strength of the lightning - the higher the value, the "taller" the arcs. Clamped to [1, 255].

parameter.name: beamWidth
parameter.description: Beam width. Clamped to [1, 127].

parameter.name: detail
parameter.description: Higher numbers equal more segments, but it's not a 1:1 correlation. Clamped to [1, 127].

parameter.name: smooth
parameter.description: If true, the arc will have large, smooth curves; if false, it will have small, jagged spikes.

parameter.name: endDrift
parameter.description: If true, the end of the arc will be able to gradually drift away from its destination in a random direction.

function.name: EmitParticle
function.summary: Emit a particle.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.description: World position.

parameter.name: vel
parameter.description: Directional velocity.

parameter.name: spriteID
parameter.description: Sprite ID in the sprite sequence slot.

parameter.name: gravity
parameter.description: Effect of gravity. Positive value ascends, negative value descends.

parameter.name: rotVel
parameter.description: Rotational velocity in degrees.

parameter.name: startColor
parameter.description: Color at start of life.

parameter.name: endColor
parameter.description: Color at end of life. This will finish long before the end of the particle's life due to internal math.

parameter.name: blendMode
parameter.description: Render blend mode.

parameter.name: startSize
parameter.description: Size at start of life.

parameter.name: endSize
parameter.description: Size at end of life.

parameter.name: life
parameter.description: Lifespan in seconds.

parameter.name: damage
parameter.description: Harm the player on collision.

parameter.name: poison
parameter.description: Poison the player on collision.

parameter.name: spriteSeqID
parameter.description: Sprite sequence slot ID.

parameter.name: startRot
parameter.description: Rotation at start of life.

function.name: EmitAdvancedParticle
function.summary: Emit a particle with extensive configuration options.
function.description: Options include sprite sequence animation, lights, sounds, and damage effects.

parameter.name: particleData
parameter.description: Table containing particle data.

function.name: EmitShockwave
function.summary: Emit a shockwave, similar to that seen when a harpy projectile hits something.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.description: World position.

parameter.name: innerRadius
parameter.description: Initial inner radius of the shockwave circle - 128 will be approx a click, 512 approx a block.

parameter.name: outerRadius
parameter.description: Initial outer radius of the shockwave circle.

parameter.name: color
parameter.description: Color.

parameter.name: lifetime
parameter.description: Lifetime in seconds (max 8.5 because of inner maths weirdness).

parameter.name: speed
parameter.description: Initial speed of the shockwave's expansion (the shockwave will always slow as it goes).

parameter.name: angle
parameter.description: Angle about the X axis - a value of 90 will cause the shockwave to be entirely vertical.

parameter.name: hurtsLara
parameter.description: If true, the shockwave will hurt Lara, with the damage being relative to the shockwave's current speed.

function.name: EmitLight
function.summary: Emit dynamic light that lasts for a single frame.
function.description: If you want a light that sticks around, you must call this each frame.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.description: World position of the light.

parameter.name: color
parameter.description: light color.

parameter.name: radius
parameter.description: Measured in "clicks" or 256 world units.

parameter.name: shadows
parameter.description: Determines whether light should generate dynamic shadows for applicable moveables.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: If provided, engine will interpolate this light for high framerate mode (be careful not to use same name for different lights).

function.name: EmitSpotLight
function.summary: Emit dynamic directional spotlight that lasts for a single frame.
function.description: If you want a light that sticks around, you must call this each frame.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.description: World position of the light.

parameter.name: dir
parameter.description: Normal which indicates light direction.

parameter.name: color
parameter.description: Color.

parameter.name: radius
parameter.description: Overall radius at the endpoint of a light cone, measured in "clicks" or 256 world units.

parameter.name: falloff
parameter.description: Radius, at which light starts to fade out, measured in "clicks".

parameter.name: distance
parameter.description: Distance, at which light cone fades out, measured in "clicks".

parameter.name: shadows
parameter.description: Determines whether light should generate dynamic shadows for applicable moveables.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: If provided, engine will interpolate this light for high framerate mode (be careful not to use same name for different lights).

function.name: EmitFogBulb
function.summary: Emit dynamic fogbulb that lasts for a single frame.
function.description: If you want a fogbulb that sticks around, you must call this each frame.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.description: position of the fogbulb

parameter.name: radius
parameter.description: measured in "clicks" or 256 world units (default 20)

parameter.name: density
parameter.description: from 0 to 255 (default 255)

parameter.name: color
parameter.description: (default Color(255, 255, 255))

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: if provided, engine will interpolate this light for high framerate mode (be careful not to use same name for different fogbulbs)

function.name: EmitBlood
function.summary: Emit blood.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.description: World position.

parameter.name: count
parameter.description: Blood sprite count.

function.name: EmitAirBubble
function.summary: Emit an air bubble in a water room.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.description: World position where the effect will be spawned. Must be in a water room.

parameter.name: size
parameter.description: Sprite size.

parameter.name: amp
parameter.description: Oscillation amplitude.

function.name: EmitWaterfallMist
function.summary: Emit waterfall mist.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.description: World position where the effect will be spawned.

parameter.name: size
parameter.description: Effect size.

parameter.name: width
parameter.description: Width of the effect.

parameter.name: rot
parameter.description: Rotation of effect in degrees.

parameter.name: color
parameter.description: Color of the effect.

function.name: EmitFire
function.summary: Emit fire for a single frame.
function.description: Will not hurt player. Call this each frame if you want a continuous fire.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.description: World position.

parameter.name: size
parameter.description: Fire size.

function.name: EmitStreamer
function.summary: Emit an extending streamer effect.

parameter.name: mov
parameter.description: Moveable object with which to associate the effect.

parameter.name: tag
parameter.description: Numeric tag with which to associate the effect on the moveable.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.description: World position.

parameter.name: dir
parameter.description: Direction vector of movement velocity.

parameter.name: rot
parameter.description: Start rotation in degrees.

parameter.name: startColor
parameter.description: Color at the start of life.

parameter.name: endColor
parameter.description: Color at the end of life.

parameter.name: width
parameter.description: Width in world units.

parameter.name: life
parameter.description: Lifetime in seconds.

parameter.name: vel
parameter.description: Movement velocity in world units per second.

parameter.name: expRate
parameter.description: Width expansion rate in world units per second.

parameter.name: rotRate
parameter.description: Rotation rate in degrees per second.

parameter.name: edgeFeatherMode
parameter.description: Edge feather mode.

parameter.name: lengthFeatherMode
parameter.description: Length feather mode. _Not yet implemented._

parameter.name: blendID
parameter.description: Renderer blend ID.

function.name: EmitFlow
function.summary: Emit a particle flowing effect.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.description: World position.

parameter.name: dir
parameter.description: Directional velocity of the particles in world units per second.

parameter.name: radius
parameter.description: Radius of emitter. The particles will be emitted inside the circle of provided radius measured from centre of world position.

parameter.name: life
parameter.description: Lifespan in seconds.

parameter.name: friction
parameter.description: Friction affecting velocity over time in world units per second.

parameter.name: maxSize
parameter.description: Max size of the particle.

parameter.name: startColor
parameter.description: Color at start of life.

parameter.name: endColor
parameter.description: Color at end of life.

parameter.name: spriteSeqID
parameter.description: Sprite sequence slot ID.

parameter.name: spriteID
parameter.description: Sprite ID in the sprite sequence slot.

function.name: MakeExplosion
function.summary: Make an explosion.
function.description: Does not hurt Lara

parameter.name: pos
parameter.description: World position.

parameter.name: size
parameter.description: Size of the shockwave if enabled.

parameter.name: shockwave
parameter.description: If true, creates a very faint shockwave which will not hurt Lara. For underwater rooms, it creates a splash if `pos` is near the surface. Shockwave uses `mainColor` if provided.

parameter.name: mainColor
parameter.description: Main color of the explosion and the shockwave. If not provided, default explosion color will be used. Must be provided for colored explosions.

parameter.name: additionalColor
parameter.description: Additional color of the explosion. If provided, explosion would randomly use the main or the additional color. If not provided, only main color will be used.

function.name: MakeEarthquake
function.summary: Make an earthquake.

parameter.name: strength
parameter.description: How strong should the earthquake be? Increasing this value also increases the lifespan of the earthquake.

function.name: GetWind
function.summary: Get the wind vector for the current game frame.
function.description: This represents the 3D displacement applied by the engine on things like particles affected by wind.()

function.name: AddLevel
function.summary: Add a level to the Flow.

parameter.name: level
parameter.description: A level object.

function.name: SetIntroImagePath
function.summary: Image to show when loading the game.
function.description: Must be a .jpg or .png image.

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: The path to the image, relative to the TombEngine executable.

function.name: SetIntroVideoPath
function.summary: Video to show when loading the game.
function.description: Must be a common video format, such as mp4, mkv, mov or avi.

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: the path to the video, relative to the TombEngine exe

function.name: SetTitleScreenImagePath
function.summary: Image to show in the background of the title screen.
function.description: Must be a .jpg or .png image. _Not yet implemented._

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: The path to the image, relative to the TombEngine executable.

function.name: EnableLaraInTitle
function.summary: Enable or disable Lara drawing in title flyby.
function.description: Must be true or false

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: True or false.

function.name: EnableLevelSelect
function.summary: Enable or disable level selection in title flyby.
function.description: Must be true or false

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: True or false.

function.name: EnableHomeLevel
function.summary: Enable or disable Home Level entry in the main menu.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: True or false.

function.name: EnableLoadSave
function.summary: Enable or disable saving and loading of savegames.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: True or false.

function.name: EnableFlyCheat
function.summary: Enable or disable the fly cheat.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: True or false.

function.name: EnablePointFilter
function.summary: Enable or disable point texture filter.
function.description: Must be true or false

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: True or false.

function.name: EnableMassPickup
function.summary: Enable or disable mass pickup.
function.description: Must be true or false

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: True or false.

function.name: GetLevel
function.summary: Returns the level by index.
function.description: Indices depend on the order in which AddLevel was called; the first added will have an index of 0, the second an index of 1, and so on.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: Index of the level.

return.description: The level indicated by the index.

function.name: GetCurrentLevel
function.summary: Returns the level that the game control is running in that moment.

function.name: EndLevel
function.summary: Finishes the current level, with optional level index and start position index provided.
function.description: If level index is not provided or is zero, jumps to next level. If level index is more than level count, jumps to title. If LARA\_START\_POS objects are present in level, player will be teleported to such object with OCB similar to provided second argument.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: Level index.

parameter.name: startPos
parameter.description: Player start position in the next level. Should correspond to OCB of `Objects.ObjID.LARA_START_POS` object in the next level.

function.name: GetStatistics
function.summary: Get game or level statistics.
function.description: For reference about statistics class, see @{Flow.Statistics}.

parameter.name: game
parameter.description: If true, returns overall game statistics, otherwise returns current level statistics.

return.description: Statistics structure representing game or level statistics.

function.name: SetStatistics
function.summary: Set game or level statistics.
function.description: For reference about statistics class, see @{Flow.Statistics}.

parameter.name: statistics
parameter.description: Statistic object to set.

parameter.name: game
parameter.description: If true, sets overall game statistics, otherwise sets current level statistics.

function.name: GetGameStatus
function.summary: Get current game status, such as normal game loop, exiting to title, etc.

function.name: GetFreezeMode
function.summary: Get current freeze mode, such as none, full, spectator or player.

function.name: SetFreezeMode
function.summary: Set current freeze mode, such as none, full, spectator or player.
function.description: Freeze mode specifies whether game is in normal mode or paused in a particular way to allow custom menu creation, photo mode or time freeze.

parameter.name: freezeMode
parameter.description: New freeze mode to set.

function.name: SaveGame
function.summary: Save the game to a savegame slot.

parameter.name: slotID
parameter.description: ID of the savegame slot to save to.

function.name: LoadGame
function.summary: Load the game from a savegame slot.

parameter.name: slotID
parameter.description: ID of the savegame slot to load from.

function.name: DeleteSaveGame
function.summary: Delete a savegame.

parameter.name: slotID
parameter.description: ID of the savegame slot to clear.

function.name: DoesSaveGameExist
function.summary: Check if a savegame exists.

parameter.name: slotID
parameter.description: ID of the savegame slot to check.

return.description: true if the savegame exists, false if not.

function.name: GetSecretCount
function.summary: Returns the player's current per-game secret count.

function.name: SetSecretCount
function.summary: Sets the player's current per-game secret count.

parameter.name: count
parameter.description: New secret count.

function.name: AddSecret
function.summary: Adds one secret to current level secret count and also plays secret music track.
function.description: The index argument corresponds to the secret's unique ID, the same that would go in a secret trigger's Param.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: An index of current level's secret (must be from 0 to 31).

function.name: GetTotalSecretCount
function.summary: Get total number of secrets in the game.

return.description: Total number of secrets in the game.

function.name: SetTotalSecretCount
function.summary: Set total number of secrets in the game.
function.description: Must be an integer value (0 means no secrets).

parameter.name: count
parameter.description: Total number of secrets in the game.

function.name: FlipMap
function.summary: Do FlipMap with specific group ID.

parameter.name: flipmap
parameter.description: ID of flipmap group to actuvate / deactivate.

function.name: GetFlipMapStatus
function.summary: Get current FlipMap status for specific group ID.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: Flipmap group ID to check. If no group specified or group is -1, function returns overall flipmap status (on or off).

return.description: Status of the flipmap group (true means on, false means off).

function.name: SetSettings
function.summary: Set provided settings table to an engine.

parameter.name: settings
parameter.description: A settings table.

function.name: GetSettings
function.summary: Get settings table from an engine.

function.name: SetStrings
function.summary: Set string variable keys and their translations.

parameter.name: table
parameter.description: Array-style table with strings.

function.name: GetString
function.summary: Get translated string.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: Key for translated string.

function.name: IsStringPresent
function.summary: Check if translated string is present.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: Key for translated string.

function.name: SetLanguageNames
function.summary: Set language names for translations.
function.description: Specify which translations in the strings table correspond to which languages.

parameter.name: table
parameter.description: Array-style table with language names.

function.name: GetAnalogKeyValue
function.summary: Get the analog value of an action key.
function.description: Returns either 0 or 1 for digital key mappings (e.g. keyboard or gamepad buttons), but may return arbitrary values in the range 0 to 1 for analog key mappings (e.g. gamepad sticks, gamepad triggers, or mouse axes).

parameter.name: actionID
parameter.description: Action ID to query.

function.name: GetAnalogAxisValue
function.summary: Get the analog value of an axis.

parameter.name: axis
parameter.description: Axis ID to fetch.

return.description: Relative analog axis value with components in the range [-1, 1].

function.name: GetMouseDisplayPosition
function.summary: Get the display position of the cursor in percent.

function.name: IsKeyHit
function.summary: Check if an action key is being hit.

parameter.name: actionID
parameter.description: Action ID to check.

function.name: IsKeyHeld
function.summary: Check if an action key is being held.

parameter.name: actionID
parameter.description: Action ID to check.

parameter.name: delaySec
parameter.description: Delay time in seconds before a hold can be registered.

function.name: IsKeyPulsed
function.summary: Check if an action key is being pulsed.
function.description: Note that to avoid a stutter on the second pulse, `initialDelaySec` must be a multiple of `delaySec`.

parameter.name: actionID
parameter.description: Action ID to check.

parameter.name: delaySec
parameter.description: Delay time in seconds between pulses.

parameter.name: initialDelaySec
parameter.description: Initial delay time in seconds on the first pulse.

function.name: IsKeyReleased
function.summary: Check if an action key is being released.

parameter.name: actionID
parameter.description: Action ID to check.

parameter.name: maxDelaySec
parameter.description: Max delay time in seconds between hit and release within which a release can be registered.

function.name: PushKey
function.summary: Simulate an action key push.

parameter.name: actionID
parameter.description: Action ID to push.

function.name: ClearKey
function.summary: Clear an action key.

parameter.name: actionID
parameter.description: Action ID to clear.

function.name: ClearAllKeys
function.summary: Clear all action keys.

function.name: Vibrate
function.summary: Vibrate the game controller if the function is available and the setting is on.

parameter.name: strength
parameter.description: Vibration strength.

parameter.name: time
parameter.description: Vibration time in seconds.

function.name: GiveItem
function.summary: Add an item to the player's inventory.

parameter.name: objectID
parameter.description: Object ID of the item to add.

parameter.name: count
parameter.description: The amount of items to add. Default is the yield from a single pickup, e.g. 1 from a medipack, 12 from a flare pack.

parameter.name: addToPickupSummary
parameter.description: If true, display the item in the pickup summary. Default is false.

function.name: TakeItem
function.summary: Remove an item from the player's inventory.

parameter.name: Object
parameter.description: ID of the item to remove.

parameter.name: count
parameter.description: The amount of items to remove. Default is the yield from a single pickup, e.g. 1 from a medipack, 12 from a flare pack.

function.name: GetItemCount
function.summary: Get the amount of an item held in the player's inventory.

parameter.name: objectID
parameter.description: Object ID of the item to check.

return.description: The amount of items. -1 indicates infinity.

function.name: SetItemCount
function.summary: Set the amount of an item in the player's inventory.

parameter.name: objectID
parameter.description: Object ID of the item amount to set.

parameter.name: count
parameter.description: The amount of items to set. -1 indicates infinity.

function.name: GetUsedItem
function.summary: Get last item used in the player's inventory.
function.description: This value will be valid only for a single frame after exiting inventory, after which Lara says "No". Therefore, this function must be preferably used either in OnLoop or OnUseItem events.

return.description: Last item used in the inventory.

function.name: SetUsedItem
function.summary: Set last item used in the player's inventory.
function.description: You will be able to specify only objects which already exist in the inventory. Will only be valid for the next frame. If not processed by the game, Lara will say "No".

parameter.name: objectID
parameter.description: Object ID of the item to select from inventory.

function.name: ClearUsedItem
function.summary: Clear last item used in the player's inventory.
function.description: When this function is used in OnUseItem level function, it allows to override existing item functionality. For items without existing functionality, this function is needed to avoid Lara saying "No" after using it.

function.name: AddCallback
function.summary: Register a function as a callback.

parameter.name: point
parameter.description: When should the callback be called?

parameter.name: func
parameter.description: The function to be called (must be in the `LevelFuncs` hierarchy). Will receive, as an argument, the time in seconds since the last frame.

function.name: RemoveCallback
function.summary: Deregister a function as a callback.
function.description: Will have no effect if the function was not registered as a callback

parameter.name: point
parameter.description: The callback point the function was registered with. See @{AddCallback}

parameter.name: func
parameter.description: The function to remove; must be in the LevelFuncs hierarchy.

function.name: HandleEvent
function.summary: Attempt to find an event set and execute a particular event from it.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: Name of the event set to find.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: Event to execute.

parameter.name: activator
parameter.description: Optional activator.

function.name: EnableEvent
function.summary: Attempt to find an event set and enable specified event in it.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: Name of the event set to find.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: Event to enable.

function.name: DisableEvent
function.summary: Attempt to find an event set and disable specified event in it.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: Name of the event set to find.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: Event to disable.

function.name: GetMoveableByName
function.summary: Get a Moveable by its name.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The unique name of the moveable as set in, or generated by, Tomb Editor.

return.description: A non-owning Moveable referencing the item.

function.name: GetMoveablesBySlot
function.summary: Get moveables by their slot.

parameter.name: slot
parameter.description: The unique slot of the moveable, e.g. `Objects.ObjID.ANIMATING1`.

return.description: Table of moveables referencing the given slot.

function.name: GetStaticByName
function.summary: Get a Static by its name.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The unique name of the static mesh as set in, or generated by, Tomb Editor.

return.description: A non-owning Static referencing the static mesh.

function.name: GetStaticsBySlot
function.summary: Get statics by their slot.

parameter.name: slot
parameter.description: The unique numerical slot of the static mesh.

return.description: Table of static meshes referencing the given slot.

function.name: GetCameraByName
function.summary: Get a Camera by its name.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The unique name of the camera as set in, or generated by, Tomb Editor.

return.description: A non-owning Camera referencing the camera.

function.name: GetSinkByName
function.summary: Get a Sink by its name.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The unique name of the sink as set in, or generated by, Tomb Editor.

return.description: A non-owning Sink referencing the sink.

function.name: GetSoundSourceByName
function.summary: Get a SoundSource by its name.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The unique name of the sound source as set in, or generated by, Tomb Editor.

return.description: A non-owning SoundSource referencing the sound source.

function.name: GetAIObjectByName
function.summary: Get an AIObject by its name.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The unique name of the AIObject as set in, or generated by, Tomb Editor.

return.description: A non-owning AIObject referencing the AI object.

function.name: GetVolumeByName
function.summary: Get a Volume by its name.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The unique name of the volume as set in, or generated by, Tomb Editor.

return.description: A non-owning Volume referencing the volume.

function.name: GetRoomByName
function.summary: Get a Room by its name.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The unique name of the room as set in Tomb Editor.

return.description: A non-owning Room referencing the room.

function.name: GetRoomsByTag
function.summary: Get rooms by tag.

parameter.name: tag
parameter.description: Tag to select rooms by.

return.description: Table of rooms containing the given tag.

function.name: IsNameInUse
function.summary: Check if a given script name is in use by any object type.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name to check.

return.description: True if name is in use and an object with a given name is present, false if not.

function.name: PlayAudioTrack
function.summary: Play an audio track.
function.description: Should be placed in the `Audio` folder. Supported formats are wav, mp3 and ogg.

parameter.name: filename
parameter.description: Filename of a track (without file extension) to play.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: Type of the audio track to play.

function.name: SetAmbientTrack
function.summary: Set and play an ambient track.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: Name of track (without file extension) to play.

parameter.name: fromStart
parameter.description: Specifies whether ambient track should play from the start, or crossfade at a random position.

function.name: StopAudioTracks
function.summary: Stop any audio tracks currently playing.

function.name: StopAudioTrack
function.summary: Stop audio track that is currently playing.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: Type of the audio track.

function.name: GetAudioTrackLoudness
function.summary: Get current loudness level for specified track type.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: Type of the audio track.

return.description: Current loudness of a specified audio track.

function.name: PlaySound
function.summary: Play sound effect.

parameter.name: soundID
parameter.description: Sound ID to play. Corresponds to the value in the sound XML file or Tomb Editor's "Sound Infos" window.

parameter.name: position
parameter.description: The 3D position of the sound, i.e. where the sound "comes from". If not given, the sound will not be positional.

function.name: StopSound
function.summary: Stop sound effect.

parameter.name: soundID
parameter.description: Sound ID to play. Corresponds to the value in the sound XML file or Tomb Editor's "Sound Infos" window.

function.name: IsSoundPlaying
function.summary: Check if the sound effect is playing.

parameter.name: soundID
parameter.description: Sound ID to check. Corresponds to the value in the sound XML file or Tomb Editor's "Sound Infos" window.

function.name: IsAudioTrackPlaying
function.summary: Check if the audio track is playing.

parameter.name: track
parameter.description: Filename to check. Should be without extension and without full directory path.

function.name: GetCurrentSubtitle
function.summary: Get current subtitle string for a voice track currently playing.
function.description: Subtitle file must be in .srt format, have same filename as voice track, and be placed in same directory as voice track. Returns nil if no voice track is playing or no subtitle present.

function.name: ShowString
function.summary: Show some text on-screen.

parameter.name: string
parameter.description: The string object to draw.

parameter.name: time
parameter.description: The time in seconds for which to show the string. If not given, the string will have an "infinite" life, and will show until @{HideString} is called or until the level is finished.

parameter.name: autoDelete
parameter.description: Should be string automatically deleted after timeout is reached. If not given, the string will remain allocated even after timeout is reached, and can be shown again without re-initialization.

function.name: HideString
function.summary: Hide some on-screen text.

parameter.name: string
parameter.description: The string object to hide. Must previously have been shown with a call to @{ShowString}, or this function will have no effect.

function.name: IsStringDisplaying
function.summary: Checks if the string is shown

parameter.name: string
parameter.description: The string object to be checked.

return.description: true if it is shown, false if it is hidden

function.name: HasLineOfSight
function.summary: Determine if there is a clear line of sight between two positions.
function.description: Limited to room geometry. Objects are ignored.

parameter.name: roomID
parameter.description: Room ID of the first position's room.

parameter.name: posA
parameter.description: First position.

parameter.name: posB
parameter.description: Second position.

return.description: true if there is a line of sight, false if not.

function.name: CalculateHorizontalDistance
function.summary: Calculate the horizontal distance between two positions.

parameter.name: posA
parameter.description: First position.

parameter.name: posB
parameter.description: Second position.

return.description: Horizontal distance between the two positions.

function.name: GetDisplayPosition
function.summary: Get the projected display space position of a 3D world position.
function.description: Returns nil if the world position is behind the camera view.

parameter.name: worldPos
parameter.description: 3D world position.

return.description: Projected display space position in percent.

function.name: PercentToScreen
function.summary: Translate a pair display position coordinates to pixel coordinates.
function.description: To be used with @{Strings.DisplayString:SetPosition} and @{Strings.DisplayString}.

parameter.name: x
parameter.description: X component of the display position.

parameter.name: y
parameter.description: Y component of the display position.

function.name: ScreenToPercent
function.summary: Translate a pair of pixel coordinates to display position coordinates.
function.description: To be used with @{Strings.DisplayString:GetPosition}.

parameter.name: x
parameter.description: X pixel coordinate to translate to display position.

parameter.name: y
parameter.description: Y pixel coordinate to translate to display position.

return.description: x X component of display position.
y Y component of display position.

function.name: PickMoveableByDisplayPosition
function.summary: Pick a moveable by the given display position.

parameter.name: position
parameter.description: Display space position in percent.

return.description: Picked moveable (nil if no moveable was found under the cursor).

function.name: PickStaticByDisplayPosition
function.summary: Pick a static mesh by the given display position.

parameter.name: position
parameter.description: Display space position in percent.

return.description: Picked static mesh (nil if no static mesh was found under the cursor).

function.name: PrintLog
function.summary: Write messages within the Log file

parameter.name: Message
parameter.description: to be displayed within the log.

parameter.name: logLevel
parameter.description: Log level to be displayed.

parameter.name: allowSpam
parameter.description: If true, allows continuous spamming of the message.

function.name: FadeIn
function.summary: Do a full-screen fade-in from black.

parameter.name: speed
parameter.description: Speed in units per second. A value of 1 will make the fade take one second.

function.name: FadeOut
function.summary: Do a full-screen fade-to-black.
function.description: The screen will remain black until a call to FadeIn.

parameter.name: speed
parameter.description: Speed in units per second. A value of 1 will make the fade take one second.

function.name: SetCineBars
function.summary: Move black cinematic bars in from the top and bottom of the game window.

parameter.name: height
parameter.description: Percentage of the screen to be covered.

parameter.name: speed
parameter.description: Coverage percent per second.

function.name: SetFOV
function.summary: Set field of view.

parameter.name: angle
parameter.description: Angle in degrees (clamped to [10, 170]).

function.name: GetFOV
function.summary: Get field of view.

function.name: GetCameraType
function.summary: Shows the mode of the game camera.

return.description: Value used by the game camera.

function.name: GetCameraPosition
function.summary: Gets current camera position.

function.name: GetCameraTarget
function.summary: Gets current camera target.

function.name: GetCameraRoom
function.summary: Gets current room where camera is positioned.

function.name: SetPostProcessMode
function.summary: Sets the post-process effect mode, like negative or monochrome.

parameter.name: effect
parameter.description: Effect type to set.

function.name: SetPostProcessStrength
function.summary: Sets the post-process effect strength.

parameter.name: strength
parameter.description: How strong the effect is.

function.name: SetPostProcessTint
function.summary: Sets the post-process tint.

parameter.name: tint
parameter.description: value to use.

function.name: PlayVideo
function.summary: Play a video file.
function.description: File should be placed in the `FMV` folder.

parameter.name: fileName
parameter.description: Video file name. Can be provided without extension, if type is mp4, mkv, mov or avi.

parameter.name: background
parameter.description: Play video in the background mode. In such case, video won't play in fullscreen, but must be shown using special animated texture type in Tomb Editor, or using @{View.DisplaySprite}.

parameter.name: silent
parameter.description: Play video without sound.

parameter.name: loop
parameter.description: Play video in a loop.

function.name: StopVideo
function.summary: Stop the currently playing video.
function.description: Only possible if video is playing in the background mode.

function.name: GetVideoPosition
function.summary: Gets the currently playing video position.

function.name: SetVideoPosition
function.summary: Sets the currently playing video position.

parameter.name: position
parameter.description: New video position.

function.name: GetVideoDominantColor
function.summary: Gets the dominant color for the current video frame.
function.description: If no video is playing, returns black.

function.name: IsVideoPlaying
function.summary: Checks if video is currently playing.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: Video file name. If provided, checks if the currently playing video file name is the same as the provided one.

return.description: True if video is currently playing.

function.name: PlayFlyby
function.summary: Play a flyby sequence.

parameter.name: seqID
parameter.description: Flyby sequence ID.

function.name: GetFlybyPosition
function.summary: Get a flyby sequence's position at a specified progress point in percent.

parameter.name: seqID
parameter.description: Flyby sequence ID.

parameter.name: progress
parameter.description: Progress point in percent. Clamped to [0, 100].

parameter.name: loop
parameter.description: Smooth the position near start and end points, as if the sequence is looped.

return.description: Position at the given progress point.

function.name: GetFlybyRotation
function.summary: Get a flyby sequence's rotation at a specified progress point in percent.

parameter.name: seqID
parameter.description: Flyby sequence ID.

parameter.name: progress
parameter.description: Progress point in percent. Clamped to [0, 100].

parameter.name: loop
parameter.description: Smooth the position near start and end points, as if the sequence is looped.

return.description: Rotation at the given progress point.

function.name: ResetObjCamera
function.summary: Reset object camera back to Lara and deactivate object camera.

function.name: FlashScreen
function.summary: Flash screen.

parameter.name: color
parameter.description: Color.

parameter.name: speed
parameter.description: Speed in units per second. Value of 1 will make flash take one second. Clamped to [0.005, 1.0].

function.name: GetAspectRatio
function.summary: Get the display resolution's aspect ratio.

function.name: Create
function.summary: Creates a custom progress bar with extensive configuration options.

parameter.name: barData
parameter.description: The table that contains all the bar data. Refer to table setup for barData.

return.description: The custombar in its hidden state

function.name: CreatePlayerBar
function.summary: Creates a bar tied to Players's attributes (Health, Air, Stamina).

parameter.name: playerBarData
parameter.description: The table that contains all the player bar data. Refer to table setup for playerBarData.

function.name: CreateEnemyHpBar
function.summary: Creates a custom health bar for a specific enemy (like a boss).
function.description: Ensure this function is called before Lara aims at the enemy if using generic enemy HP bars as well. Also be sure to call this function after increasing the HP of the enemy via LUA.

parameter.name: enemyBarData
parameter.description: The table that contains all the enemy bar data. Refer to table setup for enemyBarData.

function.name: SetEnemiesHpGenericBar
function.summary: Creates health bars for all enemies.
function.description: A new bar is generated whenever Lara targets an enemy. If the "hide text" option is disabled, the enemy's name (as set in the editor) is displayed. Multiple enemies can share the same name by appending _number to the name in the editor. If adjusting an enemy's max HP, ensure this is done before Lara targets the enemy. To create health bars for specific enemies, use CustomBar.CreateEnemyHpBar, ensuring the bar is created prior to targeting.

parameter.name: enemiesBarData
parameter.description: The table that contains all the enemies bar data. Refer to table setup for enemiesBarData.

function.name: Get
function.summary: The function retrieves an existing bar instance by its unique identifier (barName).
function.description: This function is useful when you need to access or manipulate a bar that has already been created.

parameter.name: barName
parameter.description: The unique identifier assigned to the bar when it was created using CustomBar.New

function.name: Delete
function.summary: The function removes a custom bar and its associated data from the system.
function.description: It ensures that the bar is no longer tracked or accessible in the LevelVars.Engine.CustomBars.bars table.

parameter.name: barName
parameter.description: The name of the custom bar to be deleted.

function.name: SetBarValue
function.summary: The function sets the value of a custom bar over a specified time period.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The new target to which the bar's current value should transition. (Must be a non-negative number; between 0 and the bar's maxValue.

parameter.name: time
parameter.description: The time (in seconds) over which the bar's value should transition to the target value.

function.name: ChangeBarValueOverTimespan
function.summary: The function adjusts the bar's value relative to its current or target value over a specified time span.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The relative value to add (positive or negative) to the current bar value.

parameter.name: time
parameter.description: The duration (in seconds) over which the change should occur.

function.name: SetVisibility
function.summary: The function controls the visibility of a custom bar.

parameter.name: visible
parameter.description: `true` makes the bar visible, `false` hides the bar.

function.name: IsVisible
function.summary: The function checks whether a custom bar is currently visible.

return.description: `true` if the bar is visible and `false` if it is not.

function.name: GetValue
function.summary: The function retrieves the current value of a custom bar.

return.description: Returns the current value of a custom bar.

function.name: DeleteAllBars
function.summary: The function deletes all custom bars.

function.name: ShowEnemiesHpGenericBar
function.summary: This function prevents the creation of new health bars for enemies when set to false.
function.description: However, it does not affect the health bars that have already been created.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: Specifies whether new health bars for enemies should be created.

function.name: DeleteExistingHpGenericBars
function.summary: The function deletes all the enemy health bars excluding those created by CustomBar.CreateEnemyHpBar.

function.name: SetBarRotation

function.name: ImportDiary
function.summary: Imports diary from an external file.
function.description: There are different types that must be defined. (diary, background, controls, pageNumbers, notification, image, text, narration). Each of the section's arguements are the same as the functions described in this documentation. Refer to DiarySetup.lua file for a sample script.

parameter.name: fileName
parameter.description: Name of file in the script folder without extension to import the diary from.

function.name: Create
function.summary: Creates a diary with extensive configuration options.
function.description: Parameters:

parameter.name: object
parameter.description: The pickup object that will be used to create the diary. The diary can be created using PICKUP_ITEMX (596-611) or DIARY_ITEM (986). Access the diary by selecting the item in the inventory.

parameter.name: objectIdBg
parameter.description: Object ID for the diary's sprite.

parameter.name: spriteIdBg
parameter.description: Sprite ID from the specified object for the diary's sprite.

parameter.name: colorBg
parameter.description: Color of diary's sprite.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.description: X,Y position of the diary background sprite in screen percent (0-100).

parameter.name: rot
parameter.description: Rotation of the diary's sprite (0-360).

parameter.name: scale
parameter.description: X,Y Scaling factor for the diary background sprite.

parameter.name: alignMode
parameter.description: Alignment for the diary's sprite.

parameter.name: scaleMode
parameter.description: Scaling for the diary's sprite.

parameter.name: blendMode
parameter.description: Blending modes for the diary's sprite.

parameter.name: alpha
parameter.description: Alpha value for the diary's sprite (0-255).

parameter.name: pageSound
parameter.description: Sound to play with page turn.

parameter.name: exitSound
parameter.description: Sound to play when existing the diary.

function.name: Get
function.summary: The function retrieves a diary by its unique object.
function.description: This function is useful when you need to access or manipulate a diary that has already been created .

parameter.name: object
parameter.description: The pickup object that was used to create the diary (596-611, 986).

return.description: The diary created using the object.

function.name: Delete
function.summary: The function removes a custom diary and its associated data from the system.
function.description: It ensures that the diary is no longer tracked or accessible in the LevelVars.Engine.Diaries. Please call this once a diary has served its purpose. It helps reduce the savegame size.

parameter.name: object
parameter.description: The pickup object that was used to create the diary (596-611, 986).

function.name: Status
function.summary: The function adds the callback to enable diaries in levels.
function.description: This needs to be added to every level preferably in the LevelFuncs.OnStart.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: True enables the diaries to be activated. False would disable the diaries.

function.name: IsVisible
function.summary: The function checks whether the specified diary is currently visible.

return.description: `true` if the diary is visible and `false` if it is not.

function.name: ShowDiary
function.summary: The function displays the specified diary.
function.description: Can be used to call the diary directly using volume or classic triggers.

parameter.name: pageIndex
parameter.description: The page number at which diary should be opened.

function.name: GetUnlockedPageCount
function.summary: The function returns the number of unlocked pages in the diary.

return.description: Total number of unlocked pages in the diary.

function.name: UnlockPages
function.summary: The function unlocks the specified diary up to the given page number.
function.description: This value can be overridden to lock or unlock pages as needed. A lower number can be set to restrict access to previously unlocked pages.

parameter.name: pageIndex
parameter.description: The page number up to which the diary should be unlocked.

parameter.name: notification
parameter.description: If true, and notification has been defined, a notification icon and sound will be played.

function.name: ClearPage
function.summary: The function clears the page for the diary.

parameter.name: pageIndex
parameter.description: The page number to be cleared.

function.name: AddTextEntry
function.summary: Adds a text entry to the specified page for the diary.

parameter.name: pageIndex
parameter.description: Page number to add the text entry to.

parameter.name: text
parameter.description: Text entry to be added to the page.

parameter.name: textPos
parameter.description: X,Y position of the text.

parameter.name: textOptions
parameter.description: Alignment and effects for the text. Note that text is automatically aligned to the left.

parameter.name: textScale
parameter.description: Scale factor for the text.

parameter.name: textColor
parameter.description: Color of the text.

function.name: AddImageEntry
function.summary: Adds an image entry to the specified page for the diary.

parameter.name: pageIndex
parameter.description: Page number to add the image entry to.

parameter.name: objectId
parameter.description: Object ID for the image entry sprite.

parameter.name: spriteId
parameter.description: Sprite ID from the specified object for the image entry.

parameter.name: color
parameter.description: Color of image entry.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.description: X,Y position of the image entry in screen percent (0-100).

parameter.name: rot
parameter.description: Rotation of the image entry (0-360).

parameter.name: scale
parameter.description: X,Y Scaling factor for the image entry.

parameter.name: alignMode
parameter.description: Alignment for the image entry.

parameter.name: scaleMode
parameter.description: Scaling for the image entry.

parameter.name: blendMode
parameter.description: Blending modes for the image entry.

function.name: AddNarration
function.summary: Add a narration track in the voice channel to the page.
function.description: Track is played with the draw button.

parameter.name: pageIndex
parameter.description: Page number to add the narration track to.

parameter.name: trackName
parameter.description: of track (without file extension) to play.

function.name: RemoveNarration
function.summary: Remove the narration track from the page of the specified diary.

parameter.name: pageIndex
parameter.description: Page number to remove the narration track from.

function.name: AddBackground
function.summary: Add a background image for the diary.

parameter.name: objectId
parameter.description: Object ID for the diary's background.

parameter.name: spriteId
parameter.description: Sprite ID from the specified object for the diary's background.

parameter.name: color
parameter.description: Color of diary's background.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.description: X,Y position of the diary's background in screen percent (0-100).

parameter.name: rot
parameter.description: Rotation of the diary's background sprite (0-360).

parameter.name: scale
parameter.description: X,Y Scaling factor for the diary's background.

parameter.name: alignMode
parameter.description: Alignment for the diary's background.

parameter.name: scaleMode
parameter.description: Scaling for the diary's background.

parameter.name: blendMode
parameter.description: Blending modes for the diary's background.

parameter.name: alpha
parameter.description: Alpha value for the diary's background (0-255).

function.name: ClearBackground
function.summary: Clears settings for the background for the specified diary.

function.name: CustomizeNotification
function.summary: Customizes the notification icon and sound for the diary.

parameter.name: notificationTime
parameter.description: Time in seconds the notification icon will show on screen.

parameter.name: objectId
parameter.description: Object ID for the notification icon.

parameter.name: spriteId
parameter.description: Sprite ID from the specified object for the notification icon.

parameter.name: color
parameter.description: Color of notification icon.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.description: X,Y position of the notification icon in screen percent (0-100).

parameter.name: rot
parameter.description: Rotation of the notification icon (0-360).

parameter.name: scale
parameter.description: X,Y Scaling factor for the notification icon.

parameter.name: alignMode
parameter.description: Alignment for the notification icon.

parameter.name: scaleMode
parameter.description: Scaling for the notification icon.

parameter.name: blendMode
parameter.description: Blending modes for the notification icon.

parameter.name: notificationSound
parameter.description: Sound to play with notification icon.

function.name: ClearNotification
function.summary: Clears settings for the notification system for the specified diary.

function.name: CustomizePageNumbers
function.summary: Customizes the page numbers for the diary.

parameter.name: pageNoType
parameter.description: Specifies the format for page numbers (1 or 2). 1: Displays only the current page number. 2: Formats the page number as: [Prefix][CurrentPage][Separator][UnlockedPages].

parameter.name: prefix
parameter.description: Prefix to be added for type 2 of page numbers.

parameter.name: separator
parameter.description: Separator to be added for type 2 of page numbers.

parameter.name: textPos
parameter.description: X,Y position of the page numbers.

parameter.name: textOptions
parameter.description: Alignment and effects for the text. Note that text is automatically aligned to the left.

parameter.name: textScale
parameter.description: Scale factor for the page numbers.

parameter.name: textColor
parameter.description: Color of the page numbers.

function.name: ClearPageNumbers
function.summary: Clears settings for the page numbers for the specified diary.

function.name: CustomizeControls
function.summary: Customizes the controls text for the diary.

parameter.name: textPos
parameter.description: X,Y position of the controls text.

parameter.name: textOptions
parameter.description: Alignment and effects for the text. Note that text is automatically aligned to the left.

parameter.name: textScale
parameter.description: Scale factor for the controls.

parameter.name: textColor
parameter.description: Color of the page controls.

function.name: CustomizeControlsText
function.summary: Customizes the display text for controls for specified diary.

parameter.name: string1
parameter.description: Text for Space key controls text.

parameter.name: string2
parameter.description: Text for Left key controls text.

parameter.name: string3
parameter.description: Text for Right key controls text.

parameter.name: string4
parameter.description: Text for Esc key controls text.

parameter.name: separator
parameter.description: Text for separator between controls text.

function.name: ClearControls
function.summary: Clears settings for the specified diary's controls text.

function.name: Create
function.summary: Create (but do not start) a new event sequence.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: A label to give the sequence; used to retrieve the timer later as well as internally by TEN.

parameter.name: loop
parameter.description: If `true`, the sequence will start again from its first timer once its final function has been called.

parameter.name: timerFormat
parameter.description: Same as in Timer format for Timer. This is mainly for debugging. __This will not work properly if another sequence or timer is showing a countdown.__

A variable number of pairs of arguments, each pair consisting of:
- a time in seconds (positive values are accepted and with only 1 tenth of a second [__0.1__]),
- followed by the function defined in the *LevelFuncs* table to call once the time has elapsed,
- followed by another duration in seconds, another function name, etc. You can specify a function either by its name, or by a *table* __{ }__ with the function name as the first member, followed by its arguments (see example).

function.name: Get
function.summary: Get an event sequence by its name.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The label that was given to the sequence when it was created.

return.description: The sequence if it exists, `nil` if it does not exist.

function.name: IfExists
function.summary: Check if an event sequence exists.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The label that was given to the event sequence when it was created.

return.description: `true` if the event sequence exists, `false` if it does not exist.

function.name: Delete
function.summary: Delete an event sequence.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The label that was given to the event sequence when it was created.

function.name: Start
function.summary: Begin or unpause a sequence.
function.description: If showing the remaining time on-screen, its color will be set to white.

function.name: SetPaused
function.summary: Pause or unpause the sequence.
function.description: If showing the remaining time on-screen, its color will be set to yellow (paused) or white (unpaused).

parameter.name: p
parameter.description: If `true`, the sequence will be paused; if `false`, it will be unpaused.

function.name: Stop
function.summary: Stop the sequence.

function.name: IsPaused
function.summary: Returns whether the sequence is paused.

return.description: `true` If the timer is paused, `false` if otherwise.

function.name: IsActive
function.summary: Returns whether the sequence is active.

return.description: `true` If the sequence is active, `false` if otherwise.

function.name: Create
function.summary: Create (but do not start) a new timer.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description:
A label to give this timer; used to retrieve the timer later.
__Do not give your timers a name beginning with \_\_TEN, as this is reserved for timers used by other internal libaries__.

parameter.name: totalTime
parameter.description:
Duration of the timer, in seconds.
Values with only 1 tenth of a second (0.1) are accepted, example: 1.5 - 6.0 - 9.9 - 123.6. No negative values allowed!

parameter.name: loop
parameter.description: If true, the timer will start again immediately after the time has elapsed.

parameter.name: timerFormat
parameter.description: Sets the remaining time display. See Timer format.

parameter.name: func
parameter.description: The function defined in the *LevelFuncs* table to call when the time is up
a variable number of arguments with which the above function will be called

return.description: The timer in its paused state

function.name: Delete
function.summary: Delete a timer.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The label that was given to the timer when it was created

function.name: Get
function.summary: Get a timer by its name.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The label that was given to the timer when it was created

return.description: The timer or nil if timer does not exist

function.name: IfExists
function.summary: Check if a timer exists.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The label that was given to the timer when it was created

return.description: true if the timer exists, false if it does not exist

function.name: Start
function.summary: Begin or unpause a timer.
function.description: If showing the remaining time on-screen, its default color will be set to white.

parameter.name: reset
parameter.description: If true, the timer will restart from the beginning (total time)

function.name: Stop
function.summary: Stop the timer.

function.name: SetPaused
function.summary: Pause or unpause the timer.
function.description: If showing the remaining time on-screen, its default color will be set to yellow (paused) or white (unpaused).

parameter.name: p
parameter.description: If true, the timer will be paused; if false, it would be unpaused

function.name: GetRemainingTime
function.summary: Get the remaining time of a timer in game frames.

return.description: The remaining time in game frames of timer.

function.name: GetRemainingTimeInSeconds
function.summary: Get the remaining time of a timer in seconds.

return.description:
The remaining time in seconds of timer.
Seconds have an accuracy of 0.1 tenths. Example: 1.5 - 6.0 - 9.9 - 123.6

function.name: GetRemainingTimeFormatted
function.summary: Get the formatted remaining time of a timer.

parameter.name: timerFormat
parameter.description: Sets the remaining time display. See Timer format.

function.name: SetRemainingTime
function.summary: Set the remaining time of a timer.

parameter.name: remainingTime
parameter.description:
The new time remaining for the timer in seconds.
Values with only 1 tenth of a second (0.1) are accepted, example: 1.5 - 6.0 - 9.9 - 123.6. No negative values allowed!

function.name: IfRemainingTimeIs
function.summary: Compares the remaining time with a value (in seconds).
function.description: It's recommended to use the *IfRemainingTimeIs()* method to have error-free comparisons

parameter.name: operator
parameter.description:
The type of comparison.
0 : If the remaining time is equal to the value
1 : If the remaining time is different from the value
2 : If the remaining time is less the value
3 : If the remaining time is less or equal to the value
4 : If the remaining time is greater the value
5 : If the remaining time is greater or equal to the value

parameter.name: seconds
parameter.description:
The value in seconds to compare.
Values with only 1 tenth of a second (0.1) are accepted, example: 1.5 - 6.0 - 9.9 - 123.6. No negative values allowed!
Please note: to have continuous control, the remaining time must be controlled within the *OnLoop* event and only when the Timer is active @{Timer.IsActive}.

return.description: true if comparison is true, false if comparison is false or timer does not exist

function.name: GetTotalTime
function.summary: Get the total time of a timer in game frames.
function.description: This is the amount of time the timer will start with, as well as when starting a new loop.

return.description: The timer's total time in game frames.

function.name: GetTotalTimeInSeconds
function.summary: Get the total time of a timer in seconds.
function.description: This is the amount of time the timer will start with, as well as when starting a new loop

return.description:
The timer's total time in seconds.
Seconds have an accuracy of 0.1 tenths. Example: 1.5 - 6.0 - 9.9 - 123.6

function.name: GetTotalTimeFormatted
function.summary: Get the formatted total time of a timer.
function.description: This is the amount of time the timer will start with, as well as when starting a new loop

parameter.name: timerFormat
parameter.description: Sets the remaining time display. See Timer format.

function.name: SetTotalTime
function.summary: Set the total time for a timer.

parameter.name: totalTime
parameter.description:
Timer's new total time in seconds.
Values with only 1 tenth of a second (0.1) are accepted, example: 1.5 - 6.0 - 9.9 - 123.6. No negative values allowed!

function.name: IfTotalTimeIs
function.summary: Compares the total time with a value (in seconds).
function.description: It's recommended to use the IfTotalTimeIs() method to have error-free comparisons

parameter.name: operator
parameter.description:
The type of comparison.
0 : If the total time is equal to the value
1 : If the total time is different from the value
2 : If the total time is less the value
3 : If the total time is less or equal to the value
4 : If the total time is greater the value
5 : If the total time is greater or equal to the value

parameter.name: seconds
parameter.description:
the value in seconds to compare.
Values with only 1 tenth of a second (0.1) are accepted, example: 1.5 - 6.0 - 9.9 - 123.6. No negative values allowed!

return.description: true if comparison is true, false if comparison is false or timer does not exist

parameter.name: looping
parameter.description: Whether or not the timer loops

function.summary: Assign a new function and its arguments to the timer.
function.description: It will be called when the time is up.

parameter.name: func
parameter.description: The function defined in the *LevelFuncs* table to call when the time is up
A variable number of arguments with which the above function will be called

function.name: IsPaused
function.summary: Get whether or not the timer is paused

return.description: true if the timer is paused, false if it is not paused or timer does not exist

function.name: IsActive
function.summary: Get whether or not the timer is active

return.description: true if the timer is active, false if it is not active or timer does not exist

function.name: IsTicking
function.summary: Checks if the timer has ticked (every 0.1 seconds).
function.description:
Returns `true` every 0.1 seconds when the timer is active and not paused.
TEN's engine runs on a 0.03-second internal tick, while this timer ticks every 0.1 seconds.
Use `IsTicking()` to ensure consistency and avoid unexpected behavior for example, inside the `OnLoop` event.

return.description: `true` if the timer ticked during this frame, `false` otherwise.

class.name: Collision.Probe
class.summary: Represents a collision probe in the game world.
class.description: Provides collision information from a reference world position.

method.name: Probe
method.summary: Create a Probe at a specified world position in a room.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.description: World position.

parameter.name: roomNumber
parameter.description: Room number. Must be used if probing a position in an overlapping room.

method.name: Probe
method.summary: Create a Probe that casts from an origin world position in a room in a given direction for a specified distance.
method.description: Required to correctly traverse between rooms.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.description: Origin world position to cast from.

parameter.name: roomNumber
parameter.description: Origin room number.

parameter.name: dir
parameter.description: Direction in which to cast.

parameter.name: dist
parameter.description: Distance to cast.

method.name: Probe
method.summary: Create a Probe that casts from an origin world position in a room in the direction of a given rotation for a specified distance.
method.description: Required to correctly traverse between rooms.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.description: Origin world position to cast from.

parameter.name: roomNumber
parameter.description: Origin room number.

parameter.name: rot
parameter.description: Rotation defining the direction in which to cast.

parameter.name: dist
parameter.description: Distance to cast.

method.name: Probe
method.summary: Create a Probe that casts from an origin world position, where a given relative offset is rotated according to a given rotation.
method.description: Required to correctly traverse between rooms.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.description: Origin world position to cast from.

parameter.name: roomNumber
parameter.description: Origin room number.

parameter.name: rot
parameter.description: Rotation according to which the input relative offset is rotated.

parameter.name: relOffset
parameter.description: Relative offset to cast.

method.name: Probe:GetPosition
method.summary: Get the world position of this Probe.

method.name: Probe:GetRoom
method.summary: Get the Room object of this Probe.

method.name: Probe:GetRoomName
method.summary: Get the room name of this Probe.

method.name: Probe:GetRoomNumber
method.summary: Get the room number of this Probe.

method.name: Probe:GetFloorHeight
method.summary: Get the floor height at this Probe.

method.name: Probe:GetCeilingHeight
method.summary: Get the ceiling height at this Probe.

method.name: Probe:GetWaterSurfaceHeight
method.summary: Get the water surface height at this Probe.

return.description: Water surface height. __nil: no water surface exists__

method.name: Probe:GetFloorNormal
method.summary: Get the normal of the floor at this Probe.

method.name: Probe:GetCeilingNormal
method.summary: Get the normal of the ceiling at this Probe.

method.name: Probe:GetFloorMaterialType
method.summary: Get the material type of the floor at this Probe.

return.description: Floor material type. __nil: no floor exists__

method.name: Probe:GetCeilingMaterialType
method.summary: Get the material type of the ceiling at this Probe.

return.description: Ceiling material type. __nil: no ceiling exists__

method.name: Probe:IsSteepFloor
method.summary: Check if the floor at this Probe is steep.

return.description: Steep floor status. __true: is a steep floor, false: isn't a steep floor, nil: no floor exists__

method.name: Probe:IsSteepCeiling
method.summary: Check if the ceiling at this Probe is steep.

return.description: Steep ceiling status. __true: is a steep ceiling, false: isn't a steep ceiling, nil: no ceiling exists__

method.name: Probe:IsWall
method.summary: Check if the Probe is inside a wall.
method.description: Can be used to determine if a wall and ceiling exist.

return.description: Wall status. __true: is a wall, false: isn't a wall__

method.name: Probe:IsInsideSolidGeometry
method.summary: Check if this Probe is inside solid geometry (below a floor, above a ceiling, inside a bridge, or inside a wall).

return.description: Inside geometry status. __true: is inside, false: is outside__

method.name: Probe:IsClimbableWall
method.summary: Check if there is a climbable wall in the given heading angle at this Probe.

parameter.name: headingAngle
parameter.description: Heading angle at which to check for a climbable wall.

return.description: Climbable wall status. __true: is climbable wall, false: isn't climbable__

method.name: Probe:IsMonkeySwing
method.summary: Check if there is a monkey swing sector at this Probe.

return.description: Monkey swing sector status. __true: is a monkey swing, false: isn't a monkey swing__

method.name: Probe:IsDeath
method.summary: Check if there is a death sector at this Probe.

return.description: Death sector status. __true: is a death sector, false: isn't a death sector__

method.name: Probe:Preview
method.summary: Preview this Probe in the Collision Stats debug page.

class.name: Flow.InventoryItem
class.summary: Represents the properties of an object as it appears in the inventory.

method.name: InventoryItem
method.summary: Create an InventoryItem.

parameter.name: nameKey
parameter.description: key for the item's (localised) name. Corresponds to an entry in strings.lua.

parameter.name: objectID
parameter.description: object ID of the inventory object to change

parameter.name: yOffset
parameter.description:
y-axis offset (positive values move the item down).
A value of about 100 will cause the item to display directly below its usual position.

parameter.name: scale
parameter.description:
item size (1 being standard size).
A value of 0.5 will cause the item to render at half the size, and a value of 2 will cause the item to render at twice the size.

parameter.name: rot
parameter.description: rotation around x, y, and z axes.

parameter.name: axis
parameter.description:
Axis to rotate around when the item is observed at in the inventory.
Note that this is entirely separate from the `rot` field described above. Must one of the following: X Y Z e.g. `myItem.rotAxisWhenCurrent = RotationAxis.X`

parameter.name: meshBits
parameter.description: _Not currently implemented_ (will have no effect regardless of what you set it to).

parameter.name: action
parameter.description: Item action or set of actions to assign. Item actions can be combined, for example: `ItemAction.USE | ItemAction.SAVE`.

parameter.description: Color of the lensflare.

class.name: Flow.Level
class.description: These are things things which aren't present in the compiled level file itself.

method.name: Level
method.summary: Make a new Level object.

field.name: nameKey
field.summary: (string) String key for the level's name.
field.description: Corresponds to an entry in strings.lua.

field.name: scriptFile
field.description: Path of the Lua file holding the level's logic script, relative to the location of the Tomb Engine executable.

field.name: levelFile
field.description: This path is relative to the location of the TombEngine executable.

field.name: loadScreenFile
field.description: Path of the level's load screen file (.png or .jpg), relative to the location of the Tomb Engine executable.

field.name: ambientTrack
field.summary: (string) Initial ambient sound track to play.
field.description: This is the filename of the track __without__ the .wav extension.

field.name: fog
field.summary: (@{Flow.Fog}) Global distance fog, with specified RGB color and distance.
field.description: If not provided, distance fog will not be visible.

field.name: storm
field.summary: (bool) Enable flickering lightning in the sky.
field.description: Equivalent to classic TRLE's lightning setting, as in the TRC Ireland levels or TR4 Cairo levels.

field.name: weather
field.description: Must be one of the values `WeatherType.None`, `WeatherType.Rain`, or `WeatherType.Snow`.

field.name: weatherStrength
field.description: Must be value between `0.1` and `1.0`.

field.name: weatherClustering
field.summary: (bool) Choose if weather should be clustered or not.
field.description: You can set it to `false` globally or in specific regions of your level where clusters can slip through paper-thin walls.

field.name: laraType
field.description: Must be either `LaraType.Normal` or `LaraType.Young`. E.g. `myLevel.laraType = LaraType.Young` will make Lara appear as young (with two ponytails rendered). This setting does not affect ability to use weapons or flares.

field.name: rumble
field.description: As seen in TRC's Sinking Submarine.

field.name: farView
field.summary: (int) The maximum draw distance for level.
field.description: Given in sectors (blocks). Must be at least 4.

field.name: resetHub
field.description: Resets the state for all previous levels, including items, flipmaps and statistics.

field.name: objects
field.summary: (@{Flow.InventoryItem}[]) A table of inventory object layout overrides.

field.name: secrets
field.summary: (short) Set total secret count for current level.

class.name: Flow.Settings
class.summary: Global engine settings which don't fall into particular category or can't be assigned to a specific object.
class.description: Can be accessed using @{Flow.SetSettings} and @{Flow.GetSettings} functions.

field.name: binocularLightColor
field.summary: Determines highlight color in binocular mode.

field.name: lasersightLightColor
field.summary: Determines highlight color in lasersight mode.

field.name: objectCollision
field.summary: Specify whether camera can collide with objects.

field.name: rootMesh
field.summary: Root mesh to which hair object will attach to.

field.name: offset
field.summary: Relative braid offset to a headmesh.
field.description: Not used with skinned hair mesh.

field.name: indices
field.description: Not used with skinned hair mesh.

field.name: errorMode
field.summary: How should the application respond to script errors?

field.name: multithreaded
field.description: When set to `true`, some performance-critical calculations will be performed in parallel, which can give a significant performance boost. Don't disable unless you have problems with launching or using TombEngine.

field.name: fastReload
field.summary: Can the game utilize the fast reload feature?
field.description: When set to `true`, the game will attempt to perform fast savegame reloading if current level is the same as the level loaded from the savegame. It will not work if the level timestamp or checksum has changed (i.e. level was updated). If set to `false`, this functionality is turned off.

class.name: Flow.SkyLayer
class.summary: Describes a layer of moving clouds.
class.description: To be used with @{Flow.Level.layer1} and @{Flow.Level.layer2} properties.

field.name: speed
field.description:
Values can be between [-32768, 32767], with positive numbers resulting in a sky that scrolls from west to east, and negative numbers resulting in one that travels east to west.
Please note that speeds outside of the range of about [-1000, 1000] will cause the sky to scroll so fast that it will no longer appear as a coherent stream of clouds. Less is more. City of The Dead, for example, uses a speed value of 16.

parameter.name: color
parameter.description: RGB color.

parameter.name: speed
parameter.description: Cloud speed.

method.name: AIObject:SetObjectID
method.summary: Change the object ID.
method.description: This will change the type of AI object it is. Note that a baddy will gain the behaviour of the tile it's on _before_ said baddy is triggered. This means that changing the type of an AI object beneath a moveable will have no effect. Instead, this function can be used to change an object that the baddy isn't standing on. For example, you could have a pair of AI_GUARD objects, and change one or the other two AI_PATROL_1 based on whether the player has a certain item or not.

parameter.name: ID
parameter.description: the new ID.
