parameter.description: Minimum relative rotation constraint.

parameter.name: maxRotConstraint
parameter.description: Maximum relative rotation constraint.

parameter.name: actionID
parameter.description: Input action ID to trigger the alignment.

method.name: LaraObject:TestInteraction
method.summary: Test the player against a moveable object for interaction.

parameter.name: mov
parameter.description: Moveable object to align the player with.

parameter.name: minOffsetConstraint
parameter.description: Minimum relative offset constraint.

parameter.name: maxOffsetConstraint
parameter.description: Maximum relative offset constraint.

parameter.name: minRotConstraint
parameter.description: Minimum relative rotation constraint.

parameter.name: maxRotConstraint
parameter.description: Maximum relative rotation constraint.

return.description: Returns true if the player is inside the specified bounds.

class.name: Objects.Moveable
class.summary: Represents a moveable object in the game world.
class.description: Examples include the player, traps, enemies, doors, and pickups. See also @{Objects.LaraObject} for player-specific features.

method.name: Moveable
method.summary: Used to generate a new moveable dynamically at runtime.
method.description: For more information on each parameter, see the associated getters and setters. If you do not know what to set for these, most can just be ignored (see usage).

parameter.name: objectID
parameter.description: Object ID.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: Lua name.

parameter.name: position
parameter.description: Position in level.

parameter.name: rotation
parameter.description: Rotation about x, y, and z axes.

parameter.name: roomNumber
parameter.description: The room number the moveable is in. Needed if you are dealing with overlapping rooms and need to force certain room number.

parameter.name: animNumber
parameter.description: Animation number.

parameter.name: frameNumber
parameter.description: Frame number.

parameter.name: hp
parameter.description: Hit points.

parameter.name: OCB
parameter.description: Object code bits.

parameter.name: AIBits
parameter.description: Table with six AI bits.

method.name: Moveable:GetObjectID
method.summary: Retrieve the object ID from a moveable.

return.description: A number representing the object ID of the moveable.

method.name: Moveable:SetObjectID
method.summary: Change the moveable's object ID.
method.description: This will literally change the moveable.

parameter.name: objectID
parameter.description: The new ID.

method.name: Moveable:SetOnHit
method.summary: Set the name of the function to be called when the moveable is shot by Lara.
method.description: Note that this will be triggered twice when shot with both pistols at once.

parameter.name: function
parameter.description: Callback function in LevelFuncs hierarchy to call when moveable is shot.

method.name: Moveable:SetOnKilled
method.summary: Set the name of the function to be called when the moveable is destroyed/killed.
method.description: Note that enemy death often occurs at the end of an animation, and not at the exact moment the enemy's HP becomes zero.

parameter.name: function
parameter.description: Callback function in LevelFuncs hierarchy to call when moveable is killed.

method.name: Moveable:SetOnCollidedWithObject
method.summary: Set the function to be called when this moveable collides with another moveable.

parameter.name: function
parameter.description: Callback function to be called (must be in LevelFuncs hierarchy). This function can take two arguments; these will store the two @{Moveable}s taking part in the collision.

method.name: Moveable:SetOnCollidedWithRoom
method.summary: Set the function called when this moveable collides with room geometry (e.g.
method.description: a wall or floor). This function can take an argument that holds the @{Moveable} that collided with geometry.

parameter.name: function
parameter.description: Callback function to be called (must be in LevelFuncs hierarchy).

method.name: Moveable:GetName
method.summary: Get the moveable's name (its unique string identifier).
method.description: This corresponds with the "Lua Name" field in a moveable's properties in Tomb Editor.

method.name: Moveable:SetName
method.summary: Set the moveable's name (its unique string identifier).
method.description: It cannot be blank and cannot share a name with any other existing moveable.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The new moveable's name.

return.description: true if name was successfully set, false otherwise (e.g. if another moveable has the name already).

method.name: Moveable:GetPosition
method.summary: Get the moveable's position.

method.name: Moveable:SetPosition
method.summary: Set the moveable's position.

parameter.name: position
parameter.description: The new position of the moveable.

parameter.name: updateRoom
parameter.description: Will room changes be automatically detected? Set to false if you are using overlapping rooms.

method.name: Moveable:GetJointPosition
method.summary: Get the moveable's joint position with an optional relative offset.

parameter.name: jointIndex
parameter.description: Index of a joint to get position.

parameter.name: offset
parameter.description: Offset relative to the joint.

method.name: Moveable:GetJointRotation
method.summary: Get the moveable's joint rotation.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: Index of a joint to get rotation.

method.name: Moveable:GetRotation
method.summary: Get the moveable's rotation.

method.name: Moveable:GetScale
method.summary: Get the moveable's visual scale.

method.name: Moveable:SetRotation
method.summary: Set the moveable's rotation.

parameter.name: rotation
parameter.description: The moveable's new rotation.

method.name: Moveable:SetScale
method.summary: Set the moveable's visual scale.
method.description: Does not affect collision.

parameter.name: scale
parameter.description: New visual scale.

method.name: Moveable:GetHP
method.summary: Get current HP (hit points / health points).

return.description: The amount of HP the moveable currently has.

method.name: Moveable:SetHP
method.summary: Set current HP (hit points / health points).
method.description: Clamped to [0, 32767] for "intelligent" entities (i.e. anything with AI); clamped to [-32767, 32767] otherwise.

parameter.name: HP
parameter.description: The amount of HP to give the moveable.

method.name: Moveable:GetSlotHP
method.summary: Get HP (hit points / health points) definded for that object ID.

return.description: The moveable's slot default hit points.

method.name: Moveable:GetOCB
method.summary: Get OCB (object code bit) of the moveable.

method.name: Moveable:SetOCB
method.summary: Set OCB (object code bit) of the moveable.

parameter.name: OCB
parameter.description: The new value for the moveable's OCB.

method.name: Moveable:SetEffect
method.summary: Set the effect for this moveable.

parameter.name: effect
parameter.description: Type of effect to assign.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.description: Time (in seconds) after which effect turns off.

method.name: Moveable:SetCustomEffect
method.summary: Set custom colored burn effect to moveable.

parameter.name: color1
parameter.description: The primary color of the effect (also used for lighting).

parameter.name: color2
parameter.description: The secondary color of the effect.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.description: Time (in seconds) after which effect turns off.

method.name: Moveable:GetEffect
method.summary: Get current moveable effect.

method.name: Moveable:GetItemFlags
method.summary: Get the value stored in ItemFlags[index].

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: Index of the ItemFlag, can be between 0 and 7.

return.description: The value contained in the ItemFlags[index].

method.name: Moveable:SetItemFlags
method.summary: Stores a value in ItemFlags[index].

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: Value to store in the moveable's ItemFlags[index].

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: Index of the ItemFlag where to store the value.

method.name: Moveable:GetLocationAI
method.summary: Get the location value stored in the Enemy AI.

return.description: The value contained in the LocationAI of the creature.

method.name: Moveable:SetLocationAI
method.summary: Updates the location in the enemy AI with the given value.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: Value to store.

method.name: Moveable:GetColor
method.summary: Get the moveable's color.

method.name: Moveable:SetColor
method.summary: Set the moveable's color.

parameter.name: color
parameter.description: The new color of the moveable.

method.name: Moveable:GetAIBits
method.summary: Get AIBits of a moveable.
method.description:
This will return a table with six values, each corresponding to an active behaviour. If the moveable is in a certain AI mode, the table will have a *1* in the corresponding cell. Otherwise, the cell will hold a *0*.
1 - Guard 2 - Ambush 3 - Patrol 1 4 - Modify 5 - Follow 6 - Patrol 2

method.name: Moveable:SetAIBits
method.summary: Set AIBits of a moveable.
method.description: Use this to force a moveable into a certain AI mode or modes, as if a certain nullmesh (or more than one) had suddenly spawned beneath their feet.

parameter.name: bits
parameter.description: A table of AI bits.

method.name: Moveable:GetState
method.summary: Retrieve the index of the current state.
method.description: This corresponds to the number shown in the item's state ID field in WadTool.

return.description: The index of the active state.

method.name: Moveable:GetTargetState
method.summary: Retrieve the index of the target state.
method.description: This corresponds to the state the moveable is trying to get into, which is sometimes different from the active state.

return.description: The index of the target state.

method.name: Moveable:SetState
method.summary: Set the moveable's state to the one specified by the given index.
method.description: Performs no bounds checking. *Ensure the number given is correct, else moveable may end up in corrupted animation state.*

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: The index of the desired state.

method.name: Moveable:GetAnimSlot
method.summary: Retrieve the slot ID of the animation.
method.description: In certain cases, moveable may play animations from another object slot. Use this function when you need to identify such cases.

method.name: Moveable:GetAnim
method.summary: Retrieve the index of the current animation.
method.description: This corresponds to the number shown in the item's animation list in WadTool.

return.description: The index of the active animation.

method.name: Moveable:SetAnim
method.summary: Set the moveable's animation to the one specified by the given index.
method.description: Performs no bounds checking. *Ensure the number given is correct, else moveable may end up in corrupted animation state.*

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: The index of the desired animation.

parameter.name: slot
parameter.description: Slot ID of the desired anim (if omitted, moveable's own slot ID is used).

method.name: Moveable:GetFrame
method.summary: Retrieve frame number.
method.description: This is the current frame of the moveable's active animation.

return.description: The current frame of the active animation.

method.name: Moveable:GetVelocity
method.summary: Get the moveable's velocity.
method.description: In most cases, only Z and Y components are used as forward and vertical velocity. In some cases, primarily NPCs, X component is used as side velocity.

method.name: Moveable:SetVelocity
method.summary: Set the moveable's velocity to specified value.
method.description: In most cases, only Z and Y components are used as forward and vertical velocity. In some cases, primarily NPCs, X component is used as side velocity.

parameter.name: velocity
parameter.description: Velocity represented as vector.

method.name: Moveable:SetFrame
method.summary: Set frame number.
method.description: This will move the animation to the given frame. The number of frames in an animation can be seen under the heading "End frame" in the WadTool animation editor. If the animation has no frames, the only valid argument is -1.

parameter.name: frame
parameter.description: The new frame number.

method.name: Moveable:GetEndFrame
method.summary: Get the end frame number of the moveable's active animation.
method.description: This is the "End Frame" set in WADTool for the animation.()

return.description: End frame number of the active animation.

method.name: Moveable:GetActive
method.summary: Determine whether the moveable is active or not.

return.description: True if the moveable is active.

method.name: Moveable:GetHitStatus
method.summary: Get the hit status of the moveable.

return.description: true if the moveable was hit by something in the last gameplay frame, false otherwise.

method.name: Moveable:GetRoom
method.summary: Get the current room of the moveable.

method.name: Moveable:GetRoomNumber
method.summary: Get the current room number of the moveable.

return.description: Number representing the current room of the moveable.

method.name: Moveable:SetRoomNumber
method.summary: Set the room ID of a moveable.
method.description: Use this if not using SetPosition's automatic room update - for example, when dealing with overlapping rooms.

parameter.name: roomID
parameter.description: New room's ID.

method.name: Moveable:GetStatus
method.summary: Get the moveable's status.

method.name: Moveable:SetStatus
method.summary: Set the moveable's status.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: The new status of the moveable.

method.name: Moveable:GetMeshCount
method.summary: Get number of meshes for a particular moveable.
method.description: Returns number of meshes in an object.

method.name: Moveable:GetMeshVisible
method.summary: Get visibility state of a specified mesh of a moveable.
method.description: Returns true if specified mesh is visible on a moveable, and false if it is not visible.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: Index of a mesh.

method.name: Moveable:SetMeshVisible
method.summary: Makes specified mesh visible or invisible.
method.description: Use this to show or hide a specified mesh of a moveable.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: Index of a mesh.

parameter.name: isVisible
parameter.description: true if you want the mesh to be visible, false otherwise.

method.name: Moveable:ShatterMesh
method.summary: Shatters specified mesh and makes it invisible.
method.description: Note that you can re-enable mesh later by using SetMeshVisible().

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: Index of a mesh to shatter.

method.name: Moveable:GetMeshSwapped
method.summary: Get state of specified mesh swap of a moveable.
method.description: Returns true if specified mesh is swapped on a moveable, and false if it is not swapped.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: Index of a mesh.

method.name: Moveable:SwapMesh
method.summary: Set state of specified mesh swap of a moveable.
method.description: Use this to swap specified mesh of a moveable.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: Index of a mesh.

parameter.name: objectID
parameter.description: ID of a slot to get meshswap from.

parameter.name: swapIndex
parameter.description: Index of a mesh from meshswap slot to use.

method.name: Moveable:UnswapMesh
method.summary: Unset specified mesh swap of a moveable.
method.description: Use this to bring back original unswapped mesh.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: Index of a mesh to unswap.

method.name: Moveable:SwapSkinnedMesh
method.summary: Swap skinned mesh of a moveable.
method.description: Use this to replace one skinned mesh with another.

parameter.name: objectID
parameter.description: ID of a slot to get skinned meshswap from.

parameter.name: swapIndex
parameter.description: If set, swaps skinned mesh with bone mesh with a specified index. Use if you have several skinned meshes (e.g. outfits) in a single slot.

method.name: Moveable:UnswapSkinnedMesh
method.summary: Unset skinned mesh swap of a moveable.
method.description: Use this to bring back original unswapped skinned mesh.

method.name: Moveable:Enable
method.summary: Enable the item, as if a trigger for it had been stepped on.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.description: Time (in seconds) after which moveable automatically disables.

method.name: Moveable:Disable
method.summary: Disable the item, as if an antitrigger for it had been stepped on.
method.description: For example, it will close an open door or extinguish a flame emitter. Note that this will not trigger an OnKilled callback.

method.name: Moveable:Explode
method.summary: Explode this moveable.
method.description: Also kills and disables it.

method.name: Moveable:Shatter
method.summary: Shatter this moveable.
method.description: Also kills and disables it.

method.name: Moveable:GetCollidable
method.summary: Get the item's collision state.

method.name: Moveable:SetCollidable
method.summary: Set the item's collision.

parameter.name: collidable
parameter.description: true if the caller should be collidable, false if no collision should occur.

method.name: Moveable:SetVisible
method.summary: Set the item's visibility.
method.description: An invisible item will have collision turned off, as if it no longer exists in the game world.

parameter.name: visible
parameter.description: true if the caller should become visible, false if it should become invisible.

method.name: Moveable:GetValid
method.summary: Test if the moveable is in a valid state.
method.description: Indicates that it has not been destroyed through Lua or killed by Lara.

return.description: true if the moveable is still not destroyed.

method.name: Moveable:Destroy
method.summary: Destroy the moveable.
method.description: This will mean it can no longer be used, except to re-initialize it with another moveable.

method.name: Moveable:AttachObjCamera
method.summary: Attach camera to a moveable.

parameter.name: mesh
parameter.description: Mesh of a moveable to use as a camera position.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: Target moveable to attach camera to.

parameter.name: targetMesh
parameter.description: Mesh of a target moveable to use as a camera target.

method.name: Moveable:AnimFromObject
method.summary: Borrow animation from an object.

parameter.name: objectID
parameter.description: Object ID to take animation and state ID from.

parameter.name: animNumber
parameter.description: Animation from object.

parameter.name: stateID
parameter.description: State from object.

method.name: Room:GetRoomNumber
method.summary: Get the room's number.

method.name: Room:GetName
method.summary: Get the room's unique string identifier.

method.name: Room:GetColor
method.summary: Get the room's ambient light color.

method.name: Room:GetReverbType
method.summary: Get the room's reverb type.

method.name: Room:SetName
method.summary: Set the room's unique string identifier.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: New name.

method.name: Room:SetReverbType
method.summary: Set the room's reverb type.

method.name: Room:SetFlag
method.summary: Set the room's specified flag.

parameter.name: flagID
parameter.description: Room flag ID.

parameter.description: Boolean to set the flag to.

method.name: Room:GetFlag
method.summary: Get the room's specified flag value (true or false).

parameter.name: flagID
parameter.description: Room flag ID.

method.name: Room:IsTagPresent
method.summary: Check if the specified tag is set for the room.

parameter.name: tag
parameter.description: Text tag to check (case sensitive).

method.name: Room:GetActive
method.summary: Check if the room is active.

return.description: Boolean of the room's active status.

method.name: Sink:GetName
method.summary: Get this sink's unique string identifier.

method.summary: Get this sink's world position.

method.name: Sink:SetStrength
method.summary: Set this sink's strength.

parameter.description: New strength.

method.name: SoundSource:GetPosition
method.summary: Get the sound source's position.

method.name: SoundSource:SetPosition
method.summary: Set the sound source's position.

parameter.name: position
parameter.description: The new position of the sound source.

method.name: SoundSource:GetName
method.summary: Get the sound source's unique string identifier.

method.summary: Set the sound source's unique string identifier.

method.summary: Get the sound source's sound ID.

method.name: SoundSource:SetSoundID
method.summary: Set the sound source's ID.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The sound source's new sound ID.

class.name: Strings.DisplayString
class.summary: A string appearing on the screen.
class.description:
Can be used for subtitles and "2001, somewhere in Egypt"-style messages.
Uses screen-space coordinates, with x values specifying the number of pixels from the left of the window, and y values specifying the number of pixels from the top of the window.
Since different players will have different resolutions, you should work in terms of percentages where possible, and use @{Util.ScreenToPercent|ScreenToPercent} and @{Util.PercentToScreen|PercentToScreen} when you need to use screen-space coordinates.

method.name: DisplayString
method.summary: Create a DisplayString.
method.description: For use in @{Strings.ShowString|ShowString} and @{Strings.HideString|HideString}.

parameter.name: string
parameter.description: The string to display or key of the translated string.

parameter.name: position
parameter.description: Position of the string in pixel coordinates.

parameter.name: scale
parameter.description: Size of the string, relative to the default size.

parameter.name: color
parameter.description: The color of the text.

parameter.name: translated
parameter.description: If false or omitted, the input string argument will be displayed as is. If true, the string argument will be treated as the key of a translated string specified in strings.lua.

parameter.name: flags
parameter.description: Flags which affect visual representation of a string, such as shadow or alignment.

parameter.name: area
parameter.description: Rectangular area in pixels to perform word wrapping. No word wrapping will occur if this parameter is default or omitted.

method.name: DisplayString:GetColor
method.summary: Get the display string's color.

method.name: DisplayString:SetColor
method.summary: Set the display string's color.

parameter.name: color
parameter.description: The new color of the display string.

method.name: DisplayString:GetKey
method.summary: Get the string key.

method.name: DisplayString:SetKey
method.summary: Set the string key to use.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: The new key for the display string.

method.name: DisplayString:GetScale
method.summary: Get the scale of the string.

method.name: DisplayString:SetScale
method.summary: Set the scale of the string.

parameter.name: scale
parameter.description: New scale of the string relative to the default size.

method.name: DisplayString:GetPosition
method.summary: Get the position of the string.
method.description: Screen-space coordinates are returned.

method.name: DisplayString:SetPosition
method.summary: Set the position of the string.
method.description: Screen-space coordinates are expected.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.description: New position in pixel coordinates.

method.name: DisplayString:GetArea
method.summary: Get the word-wrapping area of the string.
method.description: Screen-space coordinates are returned. If `Vec2(0, 0)` is returned, it means there is no word wrapping for this string.

return.description: area Word-wrapping area in pixel coordinates.

method.name: DisplayString:SetArea
method.summary: Set the word-wrapping area of the string.
method.description: Screen-space coordinates are expected. If set to `Vec2(0, 0)`, no word wrapping will occur.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.description: New word-wrapping area in pixel coordinates.

method.name: DisplayString:SetFlags
method.summary: Set the display string's flags.

parameter.name: table
parameter.description: The new table with display flags options.

class.name: Color
class.summary: Represents an RGBA or RGB color.
class.description: Components are specified as values clamped to the range [0, 255].

method.name: Color
method.summary: Create a Color object.

parameter.name: R
parameter.description: Red component.

parameter.name: G
parameter.description: Green component.

parameter.name: B
parameter.description: Blue component.

parameter.name: A
parameter.description: Alpha (transparency) component.

parameter.name: color
parameter.description: This color.

return.description: A string representing R, G, B, and A values.

class.name: Rotation
class.description: All angle components are in degrees, automatically clamped to the range [0, 360], excluding raw access.

field.name: x
field.summary: (float) Raw X angle component in degrees.
field.description: Does not automaticaly clamp to [0, 360].

field.name: y
field.summary: (float) Raw Y angle component in degrees.
field.description: Does not automaticaly clamp to [0, 360].

field.name: z
field.summary: (float) Raw Z angle component in degrees.
field.description: Does not automaticaly clamp to [0, 360].

method.name: Rotation
method.summary: Create a Rotation object.

parameter.name: x
parameter.description: X angle component in degrees.

parameter.name: y
parameter.description: Y angle component in degrees.

parameter.name: z
parameter.description: Z angle component in degrees.

method.name: Lerp
method.summary: Get the linearly interpolated Rotation between this Rotation and the input Rotation according to the input alpha.

parameter.name: rot
parameter.description: Interpolation target.

parameter.name: alpha
parameter.description: Interpolation alpha in the range [0, 1].

method.name: Direction
method.summary: Get the normalized direction vector of this Rotation.
method.description: Can be used to get an offset from a rotation by multiplying needed distance value with this vector.

method.name: Signed
method.summary: Get the signed version of this Rotation, clamped to [-180, 180].

parameter.name: rot
parameter.description: This Rotation.

return.description: A string showing the X, Y, and Z angle components of this Rotation.

class.name: Time
class.summary: Represents a time value in game frames, with support for formatting to hours, minutes, seconds, and centiseconds (1/100th of a second).

method.name: Time
method.summary: Create a Time object.

return.description: A new Time object initialized to zero time.

method.name: Time
method.summary: Create a Time object from a total game frame count (1 second = 30 frames).

parameter.name: gameFrames
parameter.description: Total game frame count.

return.description: A new Time object initialized with the given frame count.

method.name: Time
method.summary: Create a Time object from a formatted string.

parameter.name: formattedTime
parameter.description: Time in the format "HH:MM:SS[.CC]", where [.CC] is centiseconds and is optional.

return.description: A new Time object parsed from the given string.

method.name: Time
method.summary: Create a Time object from a time unit table (hours, minutes, seconds, centiseconds).

parameter.name: timeUnits
parameter.description: A time unit table in the format {HH, MM, SS, [CC]}, where [CC] is optional.

return.description: A new Time object initialized with the given values.

method.name: Time:GetFrameCount
method.summary: Get the total game frame count.

method.name: Time:GetTimeUnits
method.summary: Get the time in hours, minutes, seconds, and centiseconds as a table.

return.description: A table in the format {HH, MM, SS, CC}.

method.name: tostring
method.summary: Convert this Time object to a formatted string.

parameter.name: this
parameter.description: Time object.

return.description: A string showing time in "HH:MM:SS.CC" format.

method.name: Vec2
method.summary: Create a Vec2 object.

parameter.name: x
parameter.description: X component.

parameter.name: y
parameter.description: Y component.

method.name: Vec
method.summary: Create a Vec2 object.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: X and Z component.

method.name: Vec2:Normalize
method.summary: Get a copy of this Vec2 normalized to length 1.

method.name: Vec2:Translate
method.summary: Get a copy of this Vec2 translated in the input Vec2 direction by the input distance.

parameter.description: Direction vector. Normalized automatically to length 1.

parameter.description: Distance.

parameter.description: Rotation in degrees defining the direction.

parameter.name: dist
parameter.description: Distance.

method.summary: Get a copy of this Vec2 translated by an offset, where the input relative offset Vec2 is rotated according to the input rotation in degrees.

parameter.name: rot
parameter.description: Rotation in degrees rotating the input relative offset vector.

parameter.name: relOffset
parameter.description: Relative offset vector before rotation.

method.name: Vec2:Rotate
method.summary: Get a copy of this Vec2 rotated by the input rotation in degrees.

parameter.name: rot
parameter.description: Rotation in degrees.

method.name: Vec2:Lerp
method.summary: Get the linearly interpolated Vec2 between this Vec2 and the input Vec2 according to the input interpolation alpha.

parameter.name: vector
parameter.description: Interpolation target.

parameter.name: alpha
parameter.description: Interpolation alpha in the range [0, 1].

method.name: Vec2:Cross
method.summary: Get the cross product of this Vec2 and the input Vec2.

parameter.name: vector
parameter.description: Input vector.

method.name: Vec2:Dot
method.summary: Get the dot product of this Vec2 and the input Vec2.

parameter.name: vector
parameter.description: Input vector.

method.name: Vec2:Distance
method.summary: Get the distance between this Vec2 and the input Vec2.

parameter.name: vector
parameter.description: Input vector.

method.name: Vec2:Length
method.summary: Get the length of this Vec2.

method.name: __tostring
method.summary: Metafunction.
method.description: Use tostring(vector).

parameter.name: This
parameter.description: Vec2.

return.description: A string showing the X and Y components of the Vec2.

method.name: DisplaySprite
method.summary: Create a DisplaySprite object.

parameter.name: objectID
parameter.description: ID of the sprite sequence object.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: Index of the sprite in the sequence.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.description: Display position in percent.

parameter.name: rot
parameter.description: Rotation in degrees.

parameter.name: scale
parameter.description: Horizontal and vertical scale in percent. Scaling is interpreted by the DisplaySpriteEnum.ScaleMode passed to the Draw() function call.

parameter.name: color
parameter.description: Color.

method.name: DisplaySprite
method.summary: Create a DisplaySprite object with a video image.
method.description: Video should be played using @{View.PlayVideo} function in a background mode. If no video is played, sprite will not show.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.description: Display position in percent.

parameter.name: rot
parameter.description: Rotation in degrees.

parameter.name: scale
parameter.description: Horizontal and vertical scale in percent. Scaling is interpreted by the DisplaySpriteEnum.ScaleMode passed to the Draw() function call.

parameter.name: color
parameter.description: Color. __Default: Color(255, 255, 255, 255)__

return.description: A new DisplaySprite object with attached video image.

method.name: DisplaySprite:GetObjectID
method.summary: Get the object ID of the sprite sequence object used by the display sprite.

method.name: DisplaySprite:GetSpriteID
method.summary: Get the sprite ID in the sprite sequence object used by the display sprite.

return.description: Sprite ID in the sprite sequence object. Value __-1__ means that it is a background video, played using @{View.PlayVideo}.

method.name: DisplaySprite:GetPosition
method.summary: Get the display position of the display sprite in percent.

method.name: DisplaySprite:GetRotation
method.summary: Get the rotation of the display sprite in degrees.

method.name: DisplaySprite:GetScale
method.summary: Get the horizontal and vertical scale of the display sprite in percent.

return.description: Horizontal and vertical scale in percent.

method.name: DisplaySprite:GetColor
method.summary: Get the color of the display sprite.

method.name: DisplaySprite:SetObjectID
method.summary: Set the sprite sequence object ID used by the display sprite.

parameter.name: objectID
parameter.description: New sprite sequence object ID.

method.name: DisplaySprite:SetSpriteID
method.summary: Set the sprite ID in the sprite sequence object used by the display sprite.

parameter.name: spriteID
parameter.description: New sprite ID in the sprite sequence object.

method.name: DisplaySprite:SetPosition
method.summary: Set the display position of the display sprite in percent.

parameter.name: position
parameter.description: New display position in percent.

method.name: DisplaySprite:SetRotation
method.summary: Set the rotation of the display sprite in degrees.

parameter.name: rotation
parameter.description: New rotation in degrees.

method.name: DisplaySprite:SetScale
method.summary: Set the horizontal and vertical scale of the display sprite in percent.

parameter.name: scale
parameter.description: New horizontal and vertical scale in percent.

method.name: DisplaySprite:SetColor
method.summary: Set the color of the display sprite.

parameter.name: color
parameter.description: New color.

method.name: DisplaySprite:Draw
method.summary: Draw the display sprite in display space for the current frame.

parameter.name: priority
parameter.description: Draw priority. Can be thought of as a layer, with higher values having precedence. Negative values will draw sprite above strings, while positive values will draw it under.

parameter.name: alignMode
parameter.description: Align mode interpreting an offset from the sprite's position.

parameter.name: scaleMode
parameter.description: Scale mode interpreting the display sprite's horizontal and vertical scale.

parameter.name: blendMode
parameter.description: Blend mode.

enum.name: Collision.MaterialType
enum.description: Corresponds to Tomb Editor texture sound material types. To be used with @{Collision.Probe.GetFloorMaterialType} and @{Collision.Probe.GetCeilingMaterialType}.

enum.name: Effects.BlendID
enum.description: All blending modes except `OPAQUE`, `ADDITIVE` and `ALPHA_BLEND` will use depth sorting for applicable polygons. This may reduce engine performance, so it is preferable to minimize usage of other blending modes.

value.name: ALPHA_TEST
value.summary: So called "magenta transparency", every pixel can be either fully transparent or opaque.

value.name: SUBTRACTIVE
value.summary: Subtractive blending, with brighter texture areas making everything darker behind them.

value.name: SCREEN
value.summary: Similar to `ADDITIVE`, but without excessive overbright.

value.name: LIGHTEN
value.summary: Similar to `SCREEN`, but with a little different blending formula.

value.name: ALPHA_BLEND
value.description: Should be used for textures with gradually changing alpha values.

enum.name: Effects.EffectID
enum.description: To be used with @{Objects.Moveable.SetEffect} and @{Objects.Moveable.GetEffect} functions.

enum.name: Effects.ParticleAnimationType
enum.summary: Constants for particle animation type constants.

value.name: ONE_SHOT
value.summary: Frames play once and freeze on the last frame.

value.name: LIFE_TIME_SPREAD
value.summary: Frames are distributed over the particle's lifetime.

enum.name: Flow.ErrorMode
enum.description:
To be used in @{Flow.Settings.System.errorMode} setting.
In all of these modes, an *unrecoverable* error will boot you to the title level. If the title level itself has an unrecoverable error, the game will close.

value.name: SILENT
value.summary: Do nothing when a recoverable script error is hit.
value.description: Think _very_ carefully before using this setting. These error modes are here to help you to keep your scripts working properly, but if you opt to ignore errors, you won't be alerted if you've misused a function or passed an invalid argument.

value.name: WARN
value.summary: Print to the log file and continue running the application when a recoverable script error is hit.
value.description: Choose this one if booting to the title level is too much for you.

value.name: TERMINATE
value.summary: Print to the log file and return to the title level when any script error is hit.
value.description: This is the one you will want to go for if you want to know _immediately_ if something has gone wrong.

enum.name: Flow.FreezeMode
enum.description: To be used with @{Flow.GetFreezeMode} and @{Flow.SetFreezeMode} functions.

value.name: FULL
value.summary: Game is completely frozen, as in pause or inventory menus.

value.name: SPECTATOR
value.summary: Game is completely frozen, but with ability to control camera.

value.name: PLAYER
value.summary: Game is completely frozen, but with ability to control player.

value.name: COMBINE
value.summary: Combine the item with another item.

value.name: SEPARATE
value.description: Used only with objects that were combined before.

value.name: CHOOSE_AMMO_SHOTGUN
value.summary: Choose ammo type for the shotgun.

value.name: CHOOSE_AMMO_CROSSBOW
value.summary: Choose ammo type for the crossbow.

value.name: CHOOSE_AMMO_GRENADEGUN
value.summary: Choose ammo type for the grenade launcher.

value.name: CHOOSE_AMMO_UZI
value.summary: Choose ammo type for the Uzi.

value.name: CHOOSE_AMMO_PISTOLS
value.summary: Choose ammo type for the pistols.

value.name: CHOOSE_AMMO_REVOLVER
value.summary: Choose ammo type for the revolver.

value.name: CHOOSE_AMMO_HK
value.summary: Choose ammo type for the HK gun.

value.name: CHOOSE_AMMO_HARPOON
value.summary: Choose ammo type for the harpoon gun.

value.name: CHOOSE_AMMO_ROCKET
value.summary: Choose ammo type for the rocket launcher.

value.name: Normal
value.summary: Normal Lara with a single braid.

value.name: Young
value.description: This setting does not affect ability to use flares and weapons, which can be removed from inventory via scripting.

value.name: Divesuit
value.description: As seen in the underwater levels of TR5.

enum.name: Input.ActionID
enum.description: Contains mapped action IDs, raw keyboard input IDs, and raw mouse input IDs. To be used with @{Input.IsKeyHit}, @{Input.IsKeyHeld}, and other similar functions.

value.name: MOVE
value.summary: Analog axis configured for player's movement.

value.name: CAMERA
value.summary: Analog axis configured for camera movement.

enum.name: Objects.AmmoType
enum.summary: Constants for player weapon ammo types.

enum.name: Objects.WeaponType
enum.description:
To be used with @{Objects.LaraObject.GetWeaponType} and @{Objects.LaraObject.SetWeaponType} functions.
Note that this table also contains the flare and torch, as they are internally counted as "weapons" in the engine.

enum.name: Objects.MoveableStatus
enum.description: To be used with @{Objects.Moveable.GetStatus} and @{Objects.Moveable.SetStatus} functions.

value.name: DEACTIVATED
value.summary: Moveable is deactivated (was previously active and later deactivated).

enum.name: Objects.RoomFlagID
enum.description: Corresponds to room flags in Tomb Editor. To be used with @{Objects.Room.SetFlag} and @{Objects.Room.GetFlag} functions.

enum.name: Objects.RoomReverb
enum.description: Corresponds to room reverb setting set in Tomb Editor. To be used with @{Objects.Room.GetReverbType} and @{Objects.Room.SetReverbType} functions.

enum.name: Sound.SoundTrackType
enum.summary: Constants for the type of the audio tracks.
enum.description: To be used with sound track functions, such as @{Sound.PlayAudioTrack} and @{Sound.StopAudioTrack}.

value.name: LOOPED
value.summary: Used for looped ambience or music.

value.name: VOICE
value.description: Also supports subtitles, set by @{Sound.GetCurrentSubtitle} function.

value.name: CENTER
value.summary: Sets the horizontal origin point to the center of the string.

value.name: SHADOW
value.summary: Gives the string a drop shadow effect.

value.name: RIGHT
value.summary: Sets the horizontal origin point to the right side of the string.

value.name: VERTICAL_CENTER
value.summary: Sets the vertical origin point of the multiline string to the center.

value.name: INFO
value.summary: Only information messages will be shown.

value.name: WARNING
value.summary: Non-critical warnings and information messages will be shown.

value.name: ERROR
value.summary: Critical errors, non-critical warnings and information messages will be shown.

enum.name: View.CameraType
enum.summary: Constants for the type of the Camera.

value.name: NORMAL
value.summary: Standard in-game camera when weapons are holstered.

value.name: COMBAT
value.summary: In-game camera when weapons are unholstered.

enum.name: View.PostProcessMode
enum.summary: Constants for the post-process effects to apply.

value.name: EXCLUSION
value.summary: Similar to negative effect, but with different color operation.

enum.name: View.ScaleMode
enum.summary: Constants for display sprite scale modes.

value.name: FIT
value.summary: Image will proportionally fit the whole image into the sprite surface.

value.name: FILL
value.summary: Image will scale up proportionally and crop to fill all sprite surface.

value.name: STRETCH
value.summary: Image will stretch according to sprite dimensions, not taking aspect ratio into consideration.
